item.title: Desktop Alerts Tip: Building App-Specific Alert EXE’s
item.dc:creator: Kevin Ragsdale
item.description:
Compile your own application-specific version of the Desktop Alerts for each application, and include it (along with ALERT.WAV) with your installer.

The post Desktop Alerts Tip: Building App-Specific Alert EXE’s appeared first on Kevin Ragsdale.

item.title: Desktop Alerts 1.0.0 (Production Release)
item.dc:creator: Kevin Ragsdale
item.description:
After 4 years in beta, I've (finally) posted a new version of the Desktop Alerts as a Production Release on VFPX.

The post Desktop Alerts 1.0.0 (Production Release) appeared first on Kevin Ragsdale.

item.title: From A Hog To Just A Pig With A Simple Windows API Call
item.dc:creator: Kevin Ragsdale
item.description:
Reducing memory consumption of your Visual FoxPro apps is easily done with a couple of Windows API calls, thanks to Sergey.

The post From A Hog To Just A Pig With A Simple Windows API Call appeared first on Kevin Ragsdale.

item.title: Catastrophic Failure and Desktop Alerts
item.dc:creator: Kevin Ragsdale
item.description:
Yesterday, I posted a screenshot of my scariest error message. It was a message I had gotten while playing with the Desktop Alerts. Randy Jean commented that he saw the same error with the Desktop Alerts. In the Alert class nResult_Assign() method, I had the Alert calling its Release() method. So, if you had code like this: oMgr = CreateObject("VFPAlert.AlertManager") […]

The post Catastrophic Failure and Desktop Alerts appeared first on Kevin Ragsdale.

item.title: What’s the Scariest Error Message You’ve Ever Seen?
item.dc:creator: Kevin Ragsdale
item.description:
Here’s mine: Right in the middle of a presentation, too. What’s the scariest error message you’ve ever seen? This post originally appeared on the Foxite Weblogs site.

The post What’s the Scariest Error Message You’ve Ever Seen? appeared first on Kevin Ragsdale.
